blog.description: A place for quotes from books I've read.  Currently Reading: Always Look on the Bright Side of Life, Eric Idle.

summary: Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft are written by men.  -...
body:
Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft are written by men.

 - Neil Gaiman, Terry Pratchett, Good Omens

blog.name: irisbleufic
blog.title: (lives between pages)
blog.description: Holistic Writer / INTJ / Chaotic Good / Slytherin / Jewish / QIA-spec in LGBTQIA+ / autistic rabblerouser / still in my 30s / they-pronouns. Emma Goldman stan. Survivor of traumas I only discuss when relevant. Contains black tea, insomnia, poetry, & fic—but mostly just fic. If you're looking for CoT 'Verse and the rest of my Good Omens fic, you can find it here. As of 2013, all of my old LJ-era fanfiction has been uploaded to AO3. I'm the nutter behind @ask-agnes-nutter, so feel free to send asks. I moderate for the largest, most active GO Discord server, The Ritz; if you would like an invite, please DM me. You can pester me; I strongly encourage anons, because I know not everyone finds sending asks easy. If you want to know where to find my published work, email me on irisbleufic@gmail.com or send a DM. If you make art based on my writing, podfic my stories, or do anything you want me to see, tag it #irisbleufic. I won’t tell folks they shouldn't follow, but there's complex content here. I tag thoroughly. You can ko-fi me if you wish.

summary: Both your 2 fic collabs with procrastinatingbookworm and your meta essay collab with elegantidler are formidably great. I went...
question: Both your 2 fic collabs with procrastinatingbookworm and your meta essay collab with elegantidler are formidably great. I went through your AO3 and noticed you don't collab often, maybe only a few times prior to these ones.  You seem to work well with people though.  Do you think this means more collabs are likely?
answer:
Hi there, anon!  I’m incredibly pleased to hear you’ve enjoyed my Good Omens collaborations with @procrastinatingbookworm and @trans-aziraphale (elegantidler).  Your assessment is correct; prior to collaborating with these two, my past collabs with other writers, in almost exactly 25 years of writing fanfiction, are remarkably few.  I think the pre-GO-collabs tally is only four, and in four separate fandoms.  It’s usually quite rare.

So here’s what you need to know: I can collaborate very well with another writer as long as there’s high compatibility on a few highly specific fronts.  The first of these is speed.  The pace at which I work on my projects is so breakneck that I doubt 90% of the people who have wanted to collaborate with me over time would actually be up for it in practice.  The other fronts are secondary to that, but still important.  If vision regarding characterization or analytical argument isn’t similar enough, I imagine that things would go off the rails quickly.  The hardest thing to deal with in having me as a collaborator is my level of preferred editorial control and intervention; one past collaboration went somewhat poorly because, even in spite of issuing warnings up-front, I don’t think the other party was prepared for their grammar and spelling to be cleaned up so punctiliously.  I’m also fairly particular about presentation (things like…I won’t tolerate double en-dashes in lieu of m-dashes, etc.; I’m going to insist on looking as professional as it’s possible to look given AO3′s interface).  My fastidiousness can come across as hypercritical to writers who aren’t accustomed to intense editorial scrutiny.  I’m a kind editor, but I’m thorough.

All of that aside, though, I’ve been incredibly fortunate in the friends with whom I’ve had the opportunity to collaborate.  So many unusual situational factors go into making that decision, and sometimes it’s just that a silly or soulful chat goes just the right way, and before you know it?  You have a story premise that’s begging to be written.  As for your final question, whether that means there will be more?  With the two individuals in question above, absolutely.  I would put money on collaborating with either one of them again in future.  With other people as-yet unconsidered?  I’ll just have to see who comes along.

tags: somebody seriously needs to stop me
summary:
In which Rose Tyler and Anthony Crowley get to know one another.
The pair of them stood outside of her flat, the nearest...
body:
In which Rose Tyler and Anthony Crowley get to know one another.

The pair of them stood outside of her flat, the nearest streetlight flickering as if it was anxious about the nearby demonic presence.

“At the risk of sounding ungrateful, that was - by far - the weirdest, grimmest, most fucked up date I’ve ever been on,” Rose said seriously. “I mean it. And I once went on a date where I saw my own planet completely swallowed by the sun.”

Crowley smiled and she could swear she saw his forked tongue peeking out from between his insanely white teeth. “Why, thank you.”

Rose was quite sure they’d be doomed to stand there in silence forever - because he was clearly relishing her mild discomfort - when a thought occurred to her.

She grinned. “Wanna come up?”

tags: i'm having way too much fun
summary:
"Bloody hell, woman. 'Meet me in hell'? Really?"
"Well, how else am I supposed to get your attention, then?"
"You could try a...
body:
“Bloody hell, woman. ’Meet me in hell’? Really?”

“Well, how else am I supposed to get your attention, then?”

“You could try a phone call, Rose.”

“Christ, Crowley, you’re no fun at all.”

reblog.comment:

trail.content_raw:

“Christ, Crowley, you’re no fun at all.”
trail.content:
“Bloody hell, woman. ’Meet me in hell’? Really?”

“Well, how else am I supposed to get your attention, then?”

“You could try a phone call, Rose.”

“Christ, Crowley, you’re no fun at all.”

blog.name: aziraphalesbian
blog.title: michael! dude!
blog.description: i'm koraliss i'm 18 and i enjoy overthinking gay subtext

summary: aziraphale is a black and white thinker but crowley is not! aziraphale stayed on heaven’s side his whole life but crowley...
body: aziraphale is a black and white thinker but crowley is not! aziraphale stayed on heaven’s side his whole life but crowley “sauntered vaguely downwards” and got to see all the shades of grey along the way! so because he’s been both “good” and “evil,” he better understands not only how arbitrary those categories are but how easily it is to slide, accidentally or not, from good to evil or even from evil to good! aziraphale and crowley, at least at first, have very different ways of looking at humanity because crowley is on the bottom of the world looking up and aziraphale is on the top of the world looking down! but as the book progresses, they meet each other in the middle and see the other viewpoint and that’s love and that’s balance and that’s mutual understanding babey and that’s what it’s all about!!

summary:
When Rose Tyler met Anthony Crowley.
"I knew a bloke who looked like you, once. Only he had better hair and was practically a...
body:
When Rose Tyler met Anthony Crowley.

“I knew a bloke who looked like you, once. Only he had better hair and was practically a god.”

“Yes, but gods are so dull, aren’t they?”
